Corresponding assay: Cell-based olfactory receptor assay (HEK293, cAMP or Ca²? readout)
Rationale for calming association: OR1A1 responds to soft, pleasant odorants. Moderate activation supports smooth, familiar odor perception linked to reduced emotional arousal.

Corresponding assay: Heterologous OR expression assay with reporter gene
Rationale for calming association: OR2J3 is associated with fresh/green odor notes. Balanced activation contributes to emotional lightness without overstimulation.
Gentle TRPM8 engagement produces cooling and freshness that can bias autonomic tone toward relaxation when intensity is controlled.
TRPV3 contributes to warmth and comfort cues. Mild modulation supports safety and coziness rather than alertness.
